allow:
Bash(.specify/scripts/bash/create-new-feature.sh --json "to create the functional requirements for Phase 1: In-Memory Todo CLI.

Include the following specifications:

User Personas: A developer who needs a quick command-line tool to manage tasks.

Core Features:

Add Task: User can provide a title and a description.

List Tasks: Display all tasks with an ID, status \(Pending/Completed\), and title.

Update Task: Modify the title or description of an existing task by ID.

Delete Task: Remove a task from the list using its ID.

Complete Task: Toggle the status of a task to ''Completed''.

Data Requirements: Define a Task object with fields: id \(UUID or Integer\), title \(String\), description \(String\), and status \(Boolean/Enum\).

Non-Functional Requirements: > * The application must start instantly.

Data should persist only during the session \(In-Memory\).

The CLI should have clear, readable output \(use simple tables or bullet points\).

Validation: Ensure titles cannot be empty and IDs must exist for updates/deletions." --number 1 --short-name "todo-cli")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(todo-cli\): implement all 5 core features with SDD methodology

- Add task with title and optional description
- View all tasks with status indicators
- Update task title and/or description
- Toggle task completion status
- Delete task by ID

Features:
- Python 3.13+ with strict type hints
- Modular architecture \(CLI layer + Business Logic layer\)
- In-memory storage with auto-incremented IDs
- TaskStatus enum \(Pending/Completed\)
- Comprehensive unit tests for TodoManager

SDD artifacts delivered:
- spec.md, plan.md, tasks.md \(8 phases\)
- data-model.md, quickstart.md, cli-commands.md contracts
- PHR records for all implementation prompts
- guide.md for user documentation

EOF
\)")
